discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
IP scanners - Used to search for and detect IP addresses and other information related to devices on the network
Answer is A. A IP scanner scans your network for devices and information relevant to them

Selected Answer: A
i hate this question, while IP scanner is the most appropriate....if we go online and download the most popular IP scanner and Port Scanner from the same site we will find that port scanner is just the IP scanner but with port info; like just a better version

Selected Answer: A
An IP scanner is a network tool used to discover and inventory devices connected to a network by scanning IP addresses within a specified range. It identifies active devices, provides information such as IP addresses, MAC addresses, device types, and sometimes operating systems. This tool is commonly used for network discovery and mapping, making it ideal for the technician's task of finding all connected devices within the network.

Selected Answer: A
IP scanners will first scan for the IP addresses on network segments, & then conduct a deeper scan against each IP addresses to scan the ports for their services.
Port Scanners are a software that determines port statuses on the network, but does not scan for IP address & device that is connected.

Selected Answer: A
Enterprise network management suites will also be able to perform IP scanning and combine that with asset or inventory information about each host.
I would jump to port scanner because I know I will use nmap and I know nmap is port scanner. But here the best answer is IP scanner

Selected Answer: A
Download advanced ip and port scanner applications and you can see the difference between both tools.

Selected Answer: A
ip scanner is to find devices connected to the network
Port scanner is a method for determining which ports on the network are open so up scanner will be the best answer for this question

comments.content: Port scanner scan for application ports that can be accessed by external communication reaching the network this does not indicate the devices that are on this network. Best way to know devices on the network is by the physical MAC or logical (IP) address that applies to layer 2 and 3 respectively, I will say A is the answer

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
I would say port scanner

comments.content: While this is also correct, the questions asks to "BEST" get the information, and the comptia text makes it clear that it considers IP scanners to be better than simple port scanners in this respect.
IP scanner would provide more info.

questions.question_text: A company hired a technician to find all the devices connected within a network. Which of the following software tools would BEST assist the technician in completing this task?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
- If the user's PC has an incorrect subnet mask, it may not be able to communicate with other devices on the network, including the router. This would explain why the user can't access any files, but other users in the branch can.
- The fact that the IT engineer can ping the workstation from the branch router suggests that the workstation is on the same network segment as the router. However, the fact that the workstation cannot ping the router indicates that there may be an issue with the subnet mask.

The most likely cause is a missing gateway configuration. But that is not in the list of possibilities. Other causes are not valid and so I chose Subnet mask. 
But a subnet mask also could cause this issue (even when the gateway is set correct). The machine will do the XOR on the Gateway-IP and configured subnet mask and find that it is on a different network (because subnet mask is wrong not the gateway) and will not be able to find the MAC address of the router to forward the frame. 
But the router can access the machine because the machine will respond to the ARP request and give the Mac address and the router can send it frames.
A. The router can ping that device except the device cannot ping back..
Incorrect subnet mask mean the workstation is on another subnetwork that is not the switch been ping. Hence every ping made by the workstation is targeting a wrong subnetwork

Selected Answer: A
CHAT GPT SAYS A.

The most likely cause of the incident is an incorrect subnet mask.

A subnet mask is used to divide a large network into smaller subnetworks, and it determines which part of the IP address represents the network portion and which part represents the host portion. If the subnet mask is incorrect, it can cause communication issues, such as being unable to access network resources, as described in this scenario.

Selected Answer: A
Incorrect subnet mask

Selected Answer: B
I am not agree with mask. If the ping from router is back, it means that the IP layer is working well. The question is not mention IPs but names, workstation, router... so if the router can ping WORKSTATION, a name, it means that the router can resolve the WORKSTATION name. But the WORKSTATION cannot pint the ROUTER, so if the workstation can replay a ping but not request a pint to ROUTER, it looks like a DNS problem.

comments.content:
The machine cannot access files or ping the router which illuminates DNS (which isn't required unless contacting by device name) and TCP port( which would affect a single service)
Past that you are more likely to sign the wrong mask which could be a simple typo rather than a different class which would be an entirely different IP range

questions.question_text: A user in a branch office reports that access to all files has been lost after receiving a new PC. All other users in the branch can access fileshares. The IT engineer who is troubleshooting this incident is able to ping the workstation from the branch router, but the machine cannot, ping the router. Which of the following is MOST likely the cause of the incident?

A network administrator would like to purchase a device that provides access ports to endpoints and has the ability to route between networks.
Which of the following would be BEST for the administrator to purchase?

discussion.content:
B: A Layer3 switch. 
Please keep in mind a router is not used for connecting endpoints as the questions states. 
A router usually has up to 10 ethernet ports, while a switch has much more.

Selected Answer: B
A multilayer switch, or layer 3 switch allows you to connect ports to endpoints & can also perform routing functions.
What is an "endpoint?"

comments.content: Endpoints are physical devices that connect to a network system such as mobile devices, desktop computers, virtual machines, embedded devices, and servers.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
Also, it stated that the device "has the ability to route between networks". Router can route by default, therefore, its referring to a Layer 3 Switch since its a Switch that has ability to route traffic.

Selected Answer: C
A router is a networking device that provides access ports to endpoints, such as computers, servers, printers, and other network-enabled devices. It has the ability to route traffic between different networks, allowing devices on one network to communicate with devices on another network.

Routers typically operate at the network layer (Layer 3) of the OSI model and use IP addresses to forward packets between networks. They are commonly used in home and business networks to connect to the Internet and other networks.

Routers can be standalone devices or integrated into other networking equipment, such as switches or modems. They often include features such as firewall protection, Quality of Service (QoS) controls, and Virtual Private Network (VPN) support.

comments.content: Not the answer they are looking for. An access port is not what you have in a router (not the "router" you got from the ISP)

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
B is correct answer

comments.content: Later 3 switch provides both switchport access to endpoints and routing functions.

An OSI model Layer 2 switch cannot perform routing functions. However, an OSI model Layer 3 switch is capable of processing Layer 3 data and can function as a router. Layer 3 switches are generally more cost effective to use compared to using a Layer 2 switch + a separate router.

discussion.content: Could someone explain why this wouldn't be a router?

comments.content: Agreed. A deterrent is a preventative measure. Contextually, the outcome is the same here.

discussion.content:
Seems like more so that deterrent would be appropriate but preventative is fine I guess.
Source: security 601 material knowledge.

Selected Answer: D
Since it a false camera obviously it assist with prevention
Guys, a false camera!!!!

Selected Answer: D
Since it's false, it should be deterrent but preventive is the best option

Selected Answer: C
Answer is supposed to be C via Chat GPT:

C. Identification.

The purpose of a false camera is to create the illusion of surveillance and deter potential criminals or intruders. While it may not actually capture any real-time video or detect specific incidents, its presence helps with the identification of the building or area as being under surveillance.

False cameras are often used as a preventive measure to discourage unauthorized activities by creating a perception of increased security. However, it is important to note that false cameras alone do not actively prevent or detect incidents. They primarily serve as a deterrent and aid in the identification of the area as being monitored, potentially dissuading individuals from engaging in illegal or unwanted behavior.

It does make sense considering that a false camera doesn't really provide prevention as its a fake camera.

comments.content: BRO how is it going to ID someone if its a fake, sometimes you have to use common sense
When GPT chat is wrong, check with Microsoft's Bing A.I. - I use both to confirm correct answers.
Jesus Christ on a motorbike! The explanation you wrote from GPT is exactly the definition of prevention, but somehow a toy (fake) camera can offer identification..... I give up honestly.....
I asked ChatGPT three times and the answer was the same: Prevention!!!!!!!
Correctly so, it wont identify anything since its a fake(Not functional) but it can prevent somebody to do anything stopping assuming the camera is working.
sometimes chat gpt is about as smart as my pet hamster
ChatGPT is wrong. A false camera will not help with identification, it's not recording anything. It's a deterrent and nothing more.

preventative measure as it is fake

questions.question_text: A false camera is installed outside a building to assist with physical security. Which of the following is the device assisting?
Which of the following types of attacks can be used to gain credentials by setting up rogue APs with identical corporate SSIDs?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
evil twin, attacker AP setup with for example Starbucks1Guest to get you to attach, you still get out to internet but attacker can see all you do. FYI always use VPN when in public WIFI, or better yet NEVER EVER attach to any public WIFI use your cell service instead w/ VPN on of course.
Slightly different from a rogue AP

Selected Answer: B
"Clients running Linux, macOS, or a modern version of Windows will first attempt to associate with a known access point. This feature can result in network devices connecting to rogue access points, or access points offering a connection to the Internet without the authorization of the area’s network administrator. One type of rogue access point, an evil twin, can be used to trick a device into connecting to the wrong network by broadcasting the same SSID as the authorized network or another SSID that appears just as legitimate to the user." ---CompTIA Network+ Guide to Networks, 9th ed.
